title: Explainer: Why Trump has slapped 245% tariff on China
content: Donald Trump has placed high tariffs on Chinese goods. This is in response to China's control over minerals. These minerals are important for many industries. The US relies on China for these resources. Trump's move aims to protect US security. China says it will take action. The US is working to build its own mineral industry.

title: Waqf case: Will you allow Muslims to be part of Hindu trusts, SC asks Centre
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Centre on potentially allowing Muslims in Hindu religious trusts during a hearing on petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025. Concerns were raised about 'waqf by user' and the Act's implications on long-standing Islamic practices. The court is considering whether to hear the matter or refer it to a high court, with petitioners arguing the Act's provisions are unconstitutional.

title: US Vice President JD Vance to visit India, meeting with PM Modi on agenda
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, will visit Italy and India from April 18-24. In India, Vance will meet PM Modi to discuss economic and geopolitical priorities amidst ongoing tariff discussions. This visit, which includes stops in New Delhi, Jaipur, and Agra, marks Vance's second international trip as Vice President.

title: BluSmart users stranded as firm suspends ride-hailing operations: Report
content: BluSmart is experiencing widespread booking issues across Delhi-NCR, Bengaluru, and Mumbai due to its strategic shift to integrate its EV fleet with Uber's platform. This transition follows financial difficulties, including high cash burn rates and regulatory action against Gensol Engineering, linked to BluSmart's co-founder. The company has already scaled down its services significantly amid ongoing scrutiny and financial instability.

title: Trump is 'escalating' Harvard University fight; Elon Musk 'joins in' & picks side
content: A clash has erupted between Donald Trump and Harvard University over governance, hiring, and admissions, including demands to shut diversity offices. After Harvard rejected these demands, citing constitutional rights, the White House froze $2.2 billion in federal funding. Elon Musk has weighed in, supporting Trump's call to revoke Harvard's tax-exempt status.

title: 'We perhaps got too casual': Axar Patel reflects on DC’s loss to MI
content: Delhi Capitals' captain Axar Patel acknowledged complacency after their loss to Mumbai Indians. He highlighted the middle phase as a concern. DC remain unchanged for the match against Rajasthan Royals. Sanju Samson, Rajasthan Royals' captain, chose to field after winning the toss. Both teams aim for victory in their ongoing IPL 2025 campaign at Arun Jaitley Stadium.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber: Elon Musk isn’t coming back, his next move is...
content: Ross Gerber said in an interview recently that Elon Musk “doesn’t care” about the electric car manufacturer. He also defended his criticism after a backlash from retail investors.

title: SC rejects staying Waqf law, seeks Centre's reply on pleas
content: The Supreme Court addressed petitions challenging the Waqf (Amendment) Act, 2025, raising concerns about the removal of 'waqf by user' and the inclusion of non-Muslim members in Waqf boards. The court questioned the practicality of requiring registered deeds for old mosques and sought clarification from the Centre on non-Muslim representation.

title: 'There was an argument …': Rohit on dropping himself for Sydney Test
content: Rohit Sharma disclosed a disagreement with team management regarding his decision to withdraw from the Sydney Test during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Citing poor form, Rohit felt it was best for the team to allow a more prepared player, like Shubman Gill, to take his place. This decision, though met with resistance, reflects Rohit's team-first leadership philosophy.

title: Kamra row: HC grants interim relief from arrest in 'traitor' joke case
content: The Bombay high court has granted comedian Kunal Kamra interim relief from arrest in the "traitor" joke case, following an FIR filed against him for allegedly referring to Maharashtra's deputy CM Eknath Shinde as a "traitor.

title: Salesforce CEO remembers the 'life lesson' that his Indian Guru taught him
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff credits his 1996-97 India trip to meet Guru Mata Amritanandamayi in Kerala as the genesis of Salesforce. During the visit, while explaining his vision, Mata Amritanandamayi emphasized the importance of giving back. This profoundly influenced Benioff, shaping Salesforce's philanthropic ethos and his personal belief in being kind to others.

title: 'Working against law': Kharge attacks BJP over National Herald case
content: Mallikarjun Kharge criticized the ED's chargesheet against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, accusing the BJP of political vendetta and misuse of law. Congress plans nationwide protests, alleging the chargesheet is a diversion from economic issues. BJP leaders dismiss the allegations, asserting the law will take its course and accusing Congress of corruption and subservience to the Gandhi family.

title: 'Harvard a joke': Trump rants against 'woke birdbrains' teaching 'hate'
content: Donald Trump has once again targeted Harvard University. He termed it a 'joke' and unworthy of federal funds. Trump criticized Harvard's hiring choices. He mentioned Bill de Blasio and Lori Lightfoot. Trump accused the university of employing 'woke' and 'radical left' individuals. He also referenced the plagiarism allegations against Harvard's president.

title: Why Google has removed 247.4 million ads in India
content: Google suspended 2.9 million advertiser accounts and removed 247.4 million ads in India in 2024 due to policy violations. Globally, over 39.2 million accounts were suspended and 5.1 billion ads were taken down. The company implemented over 50 improvements to its LLMs and suspended 700,000 accounts, leading to a 90% drop in scam ad reports.

title: ICAI CA May admit card 2025 released for Intermediate, Foundation exam
content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) has released the admit cards for the CA Intermediate and Final May 2025 exams on its eServices portal. Candidates can log in using their SSP ID and password to download the hall tickets, which include crucial exam details. Foundation-level admit cards will be released in late April.

title: Deepika and Ranveer's new house, Sagarika Ghatge's baby boy: Top 5 news
content: Mithun Chakraborty praises Prabhas. Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh's new house is almost ready. Zaheer Khan and Sagarika Ghatge welcome a baby boy. Sharvari Wagh will star opposite Ranveer Singh in Don 3. Soha Ali Khan supports Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's decision to keep Raha away from the public eye. These stories are creating buzz in the entertainment world.

title: 'No romance, just...': Elon Musk's crazy rules for his baby mamas
content: Elon Musk doesn’t have children. He has a legion. That’s what he calls his sprawling brood, borrowing the term from Roman military units known for conquest and expansion. The mission? To out-breed the collapse of Western civilisation. The method? Unclear. But one text from Musk to a baby mama suggests “we will need to use surrogates” to “reach legion-level before the apocalypse.” As you do.

title: Gold records new high at Rs 98K, soaring more than Rs 1,500 in one day
content: Gold prices have soared to unprecedented levels, reaching Rs 98,100 per 10 grams in the national capital, fueled by escalating trade tensions between the US and China. This surge is further supported by a weakened US dollar and positive outlooks from major banks, citing inflows into gold-backed ETFs and sustained central bank buying.

title: Watch: Sunil Narine's bat fails gauge test during IPL match
content: During the IPL match between KKR and PBKS, Sunil Narine's bat failed a live gauge test, highlighting the BCCI's crackdown on oversized bats. Anrich Nortje faced a similar issue later in the game. These mid-match checks, a new protocol, aim to prevent unfair advantages, with several players already scrutinised this season for bat dimensions exceeding ICC regulations.

title: 'Yogi biggest Bhogi': Mamata attacks UP CM for remarks on Waqf protests
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee retaliated against UP CM Yogi Adityanath's criticism of Murshidabad violence, citing the Maha Kumbh stampede and alleged UP encounters. She accused Yogi of being a 'Bhogi' and defended Bengal's freedom of expression.

title: Leaked War Chats: How is Dan Caldwell linked to Trump admin's Signalgate?
content: Caldwell wasn’t the only casualty. Darin Selnick, the Pentagon’s Deputy Chief of Staff and another political appointee, was also placed on administrative leave and removed from the building. According to defense officials, both men had their security credentials suspended pending the outcome of the investigation.

title: CSK mid-season report: Can Dhoni magic turn it around for Chennai?
content: Chennai Super Kings face a tough situation in IPL 2025, sitting at the bottom with only two wins in seven games. While Noor Ahmad and Khaleel Ahmad shine with the ball, the batting struggles, especially with Ruturaj Gaikwad's injury. Rachin Ravindra leads in runs, but the middle order falters.

title: Why are top Indian GMs struggling at Freestyle Chess?
content: Indian chess fans face disappointment as their grandmasters struggle in the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam. Despite Arjun Erigaisi's quarterfinal appearance, Gukesh Dommaraju, Vidit Gujrathi, and Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa failed to advance. Coach Srinath Narayanan believes it's too early to judge, citing the high level of competition and the need for adaptation to the format.

title: World's first sperm race in LA brings male fertility into public spotlight
content: Sperm Racing, a startup founded by young entrepreneurs, is set to host the world's first sperm race in Los Angeles on April 25. This unique event aims to raise awareness about declining male fertility rates, a global health issue often overlooked. The competition will feature live-streamed microscopic races, complete with commentary and wagering, designed to mimic the female reproductive system.

title: CCTV shows YouTuber, lover carrying husband’s body on bike after murder
content: A shocking CCTV footage exposed Ravina and her lover Suresh transporting her husband Praveen's body on a bike after allegedly strangling him. Ravina, a YouTuber, confessed to the murder, which occurred after Praveen discovered her affair. The couple dumped the body in a drain on Dinod Road to avoid suspicion, but investigators uncovered the crime through CCTV footage analysis.

title: Hasan Ali offers apology for 'King kar lega' remark, but ...
content: Pakistani pacer Hasan Ali has apologised for his catchphrase supporting Babar Azam. The phrase faced criticism due to Babar's recent form. Hasan stood by Babar, calling him the best and expecting a comeback. He dismissed online trolling. Hasan took four wickets in a Pakistan Super League match. He previously defended Babar, calling him the king of Pakistan cricket.

title: Mamata calls BJP 'anti-Muslim', says it 'played trick' to pass Waqf law
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticised the BJP-led central government over the new Waqf law, alleging that the bill was passed using a "trick" without proper constitutional amendment. She accused the BJP of attempting to polarize Bengal and raised concerns about the prohibition of fish and meat in Bengali areas of Delhi.

title: 'Woman' means female from birth: UK SC rules in landmark equal rights case
content: Scotland's highest court ruled that the Equality Act's definition of 'woman' and 'sex' refers solely to biological females, siding with For Women Scotland. This decision impacts the interpretation of legal protections for women, clarifying that the Act's provisions are intended for those born female.

title: BJP's 'geography expert' dig at Mamata's 'Bengal borders Sri Lanka' gaffe
content: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar criticized Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee for her claim that Bengal shares a border with Sri Lanka. Majumdar linked this remark to the Supreme Court's decision upholding the cancellation of teacher recruitments due to irregularities. He also expressed concern over violence in Murshidabad and urged the governor to intervene for peace.

title: ​‘Jaat’ collections: Sunny Deol starrer sees sharp drop with Rs 53.97 cr
content: Gopichand Malineni's 'Jaat,' starring Sunny Deol and Randeep Hooda, had a strong opening, grossing Rs 53.97 crore in its first week. Collections peaked at Rs 14 crore on Sunday, fueled by positive word-of-mouth. However, weekday earnings declined significantly, with Wednesday experiencing a sharp drop to Rs 47 lakhs, despite a star-studded cast.

title: Four dead after bus hit vehicles, pedestrians at Rajkot traffic signal
content: In Rajkot, Gujarat, a speeding electric bus, operated by the Rajkot Municipal Corporation, caused a fatal accident at Indira Circle, resulting in at least four deaths. The bus rammed into multiple vehicles and pedestrians at a traffic signal. An angry crowd vandalized the bus, leading to police intervention, and the driver has been detained as the investigation continues.

title: Why 90s Bollywood songs are still loved more than modern hits – ETimes explores
content: Bollywood music reflects culture and emotion. 90s melodies still resonate across generations. Kumar Sanu and Alka Yagnik dominated with iconic voices. Modern songs rely on catchy hooks. Remixes introduce old tunes to new audiences. Millennials and Gen X prefer the nineties. Today's industry leans toward EDM tracks. Good music echoes across time.

title: CBSE board result for 10th, 12th likely to be declared in May
content: Central Board of Secondary Education will likely declare Class 10 and 12 results for 2025 soon. Students can check scores on cbse.gov.in. Results will also be available on DigiLocker and UMANG app. Past trends suggest results between mid and late May. Students need roll number to view results. Digital mark sheets will be on DigiLocker.

title: Muda 'scam': HC issues notice to Siddaramaiah, wife on PIL seeking CBI probe
content: The Karnataka High Court has issued notices to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his wife, BM Parvathi, regarding a petition seeking a CBI investigation into the alleged MUDA land allotment scam. This action follows a petition filed by Snehamayi Krishna, challenging the dismissal of his request to transfer the case from Lokayukta police to the CBI.

title: 'Demoralised in Gujarat for years': Rahul bats for overhaul in Cong's state unit
content: Rahul Gandhi has urged for significant reforms within the Gujarat Congress, emphasizing the importance of empowering local leaders and decentralizing decision-making processes. He stressed that district presidents should be granted genuine authority, shifting away from centralized control in Ahmedabad. Gandhi framed these internal changes as crucial for countering the BJP-RSS ideology, highlighting Gujarat's pivotal role in this ideological battle.

title: Why US elite universities are borrowing billions despite massive endowments
content: US universities, including Harvard and Princeton, are issuing record levels of debt despite massive endowments, borrowing $12.4 billion in Q1 2025 to safeguard operations amid federal funding cuts. The Trump administration's review of research grants and reduced cost recovery rates have sparked financial uncertainty. Analysts, as reported by Forbes, see this as one of the most unstable periods for higher education, prompting elite institutions to secure liquidity and prepare for long-term challenges.

title: 'Murshidabad violence pre-planned': Mamata meets Imams amid Waqf protests
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee addressed the Murshidabad unrest, refuting BJP's claims of TMC involvement in Waqf violence and accusing the Centre of a pre-planned communal riot. She blamed the central government for border security lapses and 'godi media' for spreading misinformation against Bengal.

title: New Record! Chahal equals Narine for massive IPL milestone
content: Yuzvendra Chahal's remarkable 4/28 spell against Kolkata Knight Riders helped Punjab Kings secure a 16-run victory. Chahal's performance tied him with Sunil Narine for the most four-wicket hauls in IPL history, with eight. PBKS, after being bundled out for 111, defended the low score successfully. With this win, PBKS climbed to the fourth spot in the points table.

title: Lucknow man's video on 'shortest delivery' order goes viral
content: A viral video from Lucknow captures a delivery agent's amusing reaction to a short-distance delivery within the same apartment complex. The reel, showing a video game being transported between towers for Rs 38, sparked online debate. Some found humor in the situation, attributing it to Lucknow's 'Nawabi' culture, while others criticized the agent's lighthearted commentary.

title: 'Deva bhau, Bulldozer chalao': BJP posters outside AJL house target Sonia, Rahul
content: Following the Enforcement Directorate's chargesheet against Rahul and Sonia Gandhi in the National Herald case, posters calling for "bulldozer action" have emerged in Mumbai. BJP leader Vishwabandhu Rai urged Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis to demolish properties linked to the case. The ED is also moving to seize AJL properties worth over Rs 700 crore, alleging money laundering.

title: Why Shedeur Sanders' NFL draft process, stardom are like nothing we've seen before
content: Too confident? Too famous? Here's what ex-Colorado QB Shedeur Sanders faced and why he's sure he'll succeed.

title: Trae tossed for 'making mockery of game' in loss
content: Addressing his ejection, Trae Young said he was taking out his frustration regarding the officials for giving his team what he thought was a bad whistle.

title: Trump administration sues Maine over trans ban
content: The Trump administration announced a lawsuit Wednesday against Maine's education department for not complying with the government's push to ban transgender athletes in girls' sports.

title: Pens' Letang has surgery to close hole in heart
content: Kris Letang will miss Pittsburgh's finale against Washington on Thursday night after undergoing a procedure to close a small hole in his heart.

title: Curry: 'Relief' after lifting Warriors to play-in win
content: Jimmy Butler and Stephen Curry led the Warriors over the Grizzlies in the play-in tournament and to the seventh seed in the Western Conference.

title: Hunter says game over if he can't play both ways
content: If an NFL team told Travis Hunter he had to focus on wide receiver or cornerback and not play both, it would be game over for him, he told CBS Sports.

title: Coach: Silent treatment by Rory part of the 'plan'
content: Rory McIlroy stuck to a strategy of staying laser-focused, even if that meant not saying a word to Bryson DeChambeau during the final round of the Masters.

title: Man sorry as bottle toss hit Van der Poel in face
content: A 28-year-old Belgian man has apologized after hurling a plastic bottle at former world champion Mathieu van der Poel during the Paris-Roubaix race, an act that led to a criminal investigation by French authorities.

title: How Paul Skenes is growing into life as MLB's next megastar
content: Amid the noise that comes with arriving as MLB's next megastar, the Pirates ace finds himself in the quiet.

title: NBA experts' picks for the remaining play-in showdowns
content: Our experts pick which teams make it out of the play-in tournament and which will survive the first round.

title: Bontemps' ballot: Final selections for MVP, All-NBA and every award
content: Who is the MVP? The top rookie? The Defensive Player of the Year? Tim Bontemps reveals his official award ballot.

title: College football spring transfer portal: Live news, rumors and analysis
content: The spring transfer period is open, and we're tracking the latest news. Nico Iamaleava and Gio Lopez are among the top players available.

title: How Tennessee coach Josh Heupel scored one for coaches everywhere
content: By refusing quarterback Nico Iamaleava's NIL demand, Heupel and Tennessee took a stand for the good of the program.

title: 'She can carry a franchise': What Wings can expect from Paige Bueckers in Year 1
content: All-Star? MVP? Or Hall of Famer? WNBA GMs break down what to expect from Bueckers' rookie season -- and beyond.

title: 'I know how badly they want to win': How the Senators grew into being a playoff team
content: Ottawa is back in the postseason for the first time since 2017 -- with plans to make it an annual occurrence.

title: Rashford proved he's still big-time at Villa, but PSG the superior Champions League side
content: Aston Villa showed fight, but PSG have too much going for them and are as poised as anyone for Champions League greatness.

title: Barça should have cruised by Dortmund, but they nearly crumbled
content: Flashbacks of past capitulations were fresh in the mind as Barcelona nearly contrived to give up a four-goal lead.

title: Onana to return for Man United vs. Lyon - Amorim
content: André Onana will return to the Manchester United team for their crucial Europa League clash against Lyon, head coach Ruben Amorim has confirmed.

title: Tevez targets Ronaldo, Messi for farewell game
content: Carlos Tevez wants former teammates Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi to take part in his farewell game in Buenos Aires.

title: Kane: Penalty style inspired by Neymar, Balotelli
content: Harry Kane has said he adapted his penalty-taking technique after watching Brazilian forward Neymar and other high-profile spot-kick specialists.

title: Rashford's future undecided after Villa UCL exit
content: Unai Emery said the future of on-loan Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford "depends on the next weeks."

title: Flick has to remind glum Barça: We're in semis
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick said he had to remind his disappointed players they had reached the Champions League semifinal after Tuesday's 3-1 loss to Borussia Dortmund.

title: Linkin Park to play pre-match UCL final live show
content: UEFA have announced that Linkin Park will play a pre-match show before the Champions League final kicks off on May 31.

title: WPSL Pro launching as 2nd-tier women's league
content: The United States will soon have a second-division women's professional league for the first time. WPSL Pro plans to launch late next year as a second-tier league, the organization announced on Wednesday.

title: Luis Enrique: Semi-bound PSG world's 'best squad'
content: Paris Saint-Germain coach Luis Enrique hailed his squad as the best in the world on Tuesday after they reached the Champions League semifinals with a 5-4 aggregate win over Aston Villa.

title: Previewing the NCAA gymnastics championships
content: Can LSU defend its title? Or will OU get redemption? What to watch as the NCAA gymnastics championships begin Thursday.

title: What comes next for the flailing Suns -- and Kevin Durant
content: After firing their third coach in three years, the Suns' next -- and perhaps only -- move is trading Kevin Durant.

title: College baseball's next big thing: Rintaro Sasaki
content: Rintaro Sasaki chose to play for Stanford over going pro in Japan, so what exactly brought him to college baseball?

title: Surprise teams, contenders and OU's quest to five-peat: Big questions for the rest of the softball season
content: Is anyone outpitching NiJaree Canady? Which teams are serious contenders? Bill Connelly dives into the 2025 college softball season thus far.

title: 2025-26 Way-Too-Early Top 25: Teams on the rise in version 2.0
content: Texas Tech and BYU climb our Way-Too-Early 2025-26 rankings thanks to key player returns and portal additions.

title: Women's college basketball transfer rankings: Fulwiley one of seven new players in top 25
content: South Carolina-bound Ta'Niya Latson tops the transfer rankings, but MiLaysia Fulwiley and Janiah Barker break into the top 10.

title: John Cena's most memorable WrestleMania matches
content: Before Cena dons the jorts a final time at WrestleMania, we look at 10 matches that have shaped his legacy.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Wirtz prefers Real Madrid over Man City move
content: Bayer Leverkusen star Florian Wirtz would join Real Madrid over Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news and gossip.

title: Winners and losers from the Masters, plus predictions for the rest of this year's majors
content: From Rory McIlroy to early favorites for the final three majors of the golf season, we look at five big questions coming out of Augusta and looking forward to the rest of the 2025 season.

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Who earned a spot, Volkanovski or Jandiroba?
content: There's a new featherweight champion and new strawweight No. 1 contender -- but just one is in ESPN's top 10.

title: Who will new featherweight champ Volkanovski fight in first defense?
content: Should Alexander Volkanovski get Movsar Evloev? Is Paddy Pimblett-Charles Oliveira a real possibility?

title: Telangana set to bag ₹29,000 crore renewable energy projects
content: Ecoren Energy proposes ₹27,000 crore renewable energy projects; GPSR Arya intends to set up 15 compressed biogas projects with ₹2,000 crore

title: Kerala Chicken: chilled chicken products to be rolled out next month
content: Mini processing unit has equipment such as killing cone, boiler, and defeathering machine, but is not automated. It has a capacity of 500 birds a day

title: A.P. capital Amaravati gets smart infrastructure push; 14 road work packages under way
content: APCRDA will complete trunk roads in one and a half years and Land Pooling Scheme layout infrastructure in two and a half years, says MA&UD Minister

title: Safe havens: how big tree hollows shelter elusive Nilgiri martens
content: KFRI study reveals that the rare mammal rely on old, hollow trees for survival, highlighting the urgent need to protect these trees

title: Karnataka relaxes age criteria for class 1 admission for 2025-26 to 5 yrs and 5 months
content: Minister Madhu Bangarappa says this relaxation will not be given next year, and the minimum age of 6 years would be strictly implemented

title: ‘Fake’ cardiologist row: Damoh Mission Hospital management booked for forgery
content: As per the FIR seen by The Hindu, the hospital has been accused of forging the signatures of a Jabalpur-based doctor and using forged documents to obtain the cath lab licence through online registration

title: Forest dept. books case against 18, including parish priest
content: Forest officials had demolished a cross erected beside the Neyyassery-Thokkumban road near Thommankuth, which they claim to be reserve forest

title: Karnataka to focus on mainstreaming climate actions to boost sustainability, create jobs, bring in economic growth
content: The 2025–26 roadmap prepared by BBMP to address climate change impacts includes afforestation targets of 50,000 hectares under a new foundation that enables CSR participation

title: Congress OBC leaders press for implementation of caste census report
content: The demand by OBC leaders comes in the backdrop of opposition to the report by Vokkaliga and Veerashaiava-Lingayats

title: MP Purandeswari promises ₹35 lakh to renovate Veeresalingam’s house
content: Purandeswari pledges funds for Veeresalingam house renovation on the banks of the Godavari river in Rajamahendravaram on his 177th birth anniversary

title: Destined to delight Malayali audience on screen
content: Actor Sheela recalls how she was cast in her first Malayalam film  Bhagyajathakam and how she became serious about acting

title: SCCL formally opens Naini coal mine in Odisha
content: Deputy CM Bhatti Vikramarka launches it virtually from Hyderabad; SCCL CMD presides over the event from Naini

title: Farooq Abdullah cites Queen Elizabeth’s ‘recollections may vary’ phrase, as ex-R&AW chief’s book corners him over Article 370
content: In The Chief Minister and the Spy, former R&AW chief A.S. Dulat, considered close to the Abdullahs, described the former J&K Chief Minister as one ‘who was extremely open about his willingness to work with Delhi’ and could even have helped in passing its abrogation in the J&K Assembly

title: 88-year-old undergoes rare voice surgery in Guntur
content: Thyroplasty, the surgery performed on the elder citizen, is believed to be the first documented case of the procedure performed on a patient of this age worldwide

title: Kerala plans to revise its non-communicable diseases protocol
content: The govt. is getting together a multidisciplinary team of  experts in medicine, neurology, endocrinology, nephrology, cardiology, nephrology, oncology and public health to deliberate on a new protocol, with an accent on preventing multi-organ complications

title: Muthalapozhy to have a modern fishing harbour by 2027, dredging to be expedited
content: The government will open  sandbars formed off the Vakkom, Chirayankeezhu, Kadakkavoor, Anchuthengu, Azhoor, and Kadinamkulam coastal localities. They were the leading cause of tidal surges and flooding in the localities and adjacent areas

title: Speeding van kills two NREGA workers, injures four in West Godavari
content: The workers were modernising an irrigation canal in Nakkavaripalem village under Mogalturu police limits in West Godavari district

title: BJP’s minority outreach programme from April 20 to May 5 on new Waqf Act
content: Party vice president and State convenor of the Waqf Awareness Mission G. Manohar Reddy said the objective of the programme is to present ‘true facts’ and enlighten the common people in the minority community about the salient features and reasons behind taking up certain amendments in the Waqf Act

title: Anantapur Collector cautions against fake social media accounts
content: Some people have been asking for money through fake accounts created in his name and other senior government officials, says Vinod Kumar

title: Sonia, Rahul will face punishment in National Herald case, says Vijayendra
content: The Siddaramaiah-led Congress government is shaken by our protest rallies, says the State BJP president

title: Panchayat polls: Congress files complaint against Assam BJP legislator
content: Suren Phukan allegedly threatened voters that they would lose access to government schemes if they did not vote for his party in the two-phase rural polls due in May

title: Operation D-Hunt: Kerala Police tighten net on narcotics trade in Thiruvananthapuram
content: City police registers 488 cases and arrests 501 people between February 22 and April 13. Drive focussing on dismantling supply chains and intercepting traffickers who smuggle such contraband across inter-State borders into the district

title: TG govt. depts advised to procure electronic devices, access related services only through TGTS
content: Citing isolated instances of some depts making purchases directly, IT Minister’s office says allowing independent purchases raises concerns around quality assurance, pricing inconsistencies and potential data security vulnerabilities

title: Congress leaders stage protest demanding withdrawal of ‘false cases’ against Sonia, Rahul
content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) had filed a chargesheet against the Gandhis in the National Herald case only at the behest of the Union government, which wanted to suppress the voices of the Opposition in the country, alleges Ambati Krishna Rao

title: Allay doubts over quality of watermelons, Madras High Court directs horticulture department
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy passes the orders on a writ petition filed by the president of Chengalpattu Farmers Welfare Association

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Central Railway installs India’s first ATM on Panchavati Express
content: The ATM has been put up in a cubicle at the rear end of the coach, a space earlier used as a makeshift pantry

title: CM Stalin introduces two Bills on nomination of persons with disabilities to all local bodies in Tamil Nadu
content: In February, he said the State government would introduce legislation to ensure representation of persons with disabilities in local bodies

title: Muslim federation extends support to protests against Waqf (Amendment) Act in Mangaluru
content: The protest on April 18 was called by Ulemas while the one on April 29 was by the Muslim Central Committee.

title: IICT and CCMB working to come up with drugs and diagnostics for potential emerging viruses
content: Tarnaka-Habsiguda road in Hyderabad is proposed to be taken up as a ‘Science Corridor’ with the help of Hyderabad Metro Rail

title: 11 cadres of banned outfits arrested in Manipur
content: 11 cadres of proscribed outfits arrested in Manipur for extortion, recovery of weapons; State under President’s rule since February

title: Govt bans manufacture, sale of 35 fixed-dose combination drugs
content: CDSCO directs States to halt sale of unapproved FDC drugs, emphasizing safety and compliance with drug regulations.

title: Indian, Chinese officials speed up efforts on Kailash Manasarovar Yatra resumption agreement
content: As the deadline for choosing pilgrims runs close next month, sources said they hoped for a breakthrough ‘shortly’

title: Madras High Court bans 28 plastic products across Western Ghats in Tamil Nadu
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy make it clear that the ban would extend from the Nilgiris to Agasthiyar Biosphere in Kanniyakumari district

title: Justice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai to succeed Sanjeev Khanna as the next Chief Justice of India
content: Justice Gavai, who was elevated as a judge of the Supreme Court on May 24, 2019, would have a tenure of over six months as the CJI. He is due to retire on November 23, 2025

title: Tirunelveli ‘Iruttukkadai Halwa’ family alleges dowry harassment, appeals to CM Stalin for daughter’s safety
content: In their complaint, Kanishka, who got married to Balram Singh of Coimbatore on February 2, and her mother Kavitha stated that her husband and in-laws had been harassing her, demanding additional dowry

title: RDO office in Kerala’s Palakkad receives bomb threat by email, police search premises
content: Purported email also claims that detonation is timed to coincide with alleged ‘elimination’ of AIADMK leader Edappadi K. Palaniswami

title: TiE to host workshop on storytelling in Mysuru
content: The workshop will focus on ‘helping entrepreneurs and business professionals master the art of storytelling to drive impact, inspire action and build lasting connections’

title: Supreme Court says no to plea for regulatory framework on cryptocurrencies
content: The counsel appearing for the petitioners claimed several complaints were filed across the country over cryptocurrencies

title: Miscreants rob 241 gm of gold ornaments from car atop Vijayawada’s Indrakeeladri
content: The victim’s family was travelling from Hyderabad to Amalapuram and parked the vehicle at Om turning atop Indrakeeladri, say police

title: Wakf Act amendments: Congress, Muslim JAC staged protest in Vizianagaram
content: JAC leaders Shaik Mustafa, Habeeb Mohammed, P.M. Rahamtulla and others led the rally from Ambati Satram junction to Collector’s office

title: Govt plans to take up 50 airport development projects in 5 years
content: The Centre plans 50 airport projects in 5 years to boost aviation ecosystem, focusing on PPP and land acquisition

title: T.N. government issues advisory reiterating use of Tamil as official language in departments
content: An advisory issued by V. Rajaraman, Secretary, Tamil Development and Information Department on April 14, noted previous orders that specified that government orders should only be issued in Tamil, and that circulars should also be in Tamil.

title: Summer camp in Mysuru seeks to blend children with nature
content: A total of 65 children are participate in the summer camp whose activities and events include dance drama, Yakshagana, clay art, public speaking skills, folk songs, documentaries, visits to museums and activities on reptile and bird conservation

title: Kerala CM protecting wrongdoers loyal to him, says Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan
content: Satheesan says CM had shielded his Chief Principal Secretary K.M. Abraham from VACB inquiry in disproportionate assets case. But High Court has ‘blown the whistle on the ruse’ by ordering CBI inquiry against Abraham

title: We seem demoralised in Gujarat, but only Congress can defeat RSS-BJP: Rahul Gandhi
content: Mr. Gandhi was addressing booth-level Congress workers at Modasa town in Arvalli district after launching a pilot project of strengthening district units

title: Farmers urge authorities to reject claim of Pramoda Devi Wadiyar over land in Chamarajanagar
content: Karnataka Prantha Raitha Sangha urges authorities to immediately transfer cultivation and ownership rights to the farmers concerned, and prepare to defend their rights in any civil dispute that may arise

title: Telangana tops in policing, struggles in delivering holistic justice
content: Telangana’s third rank in India Justice Report underscores its leadership in policing and administrative efficiency. However, this progress is tempered by persistent structural issues in the judiciary, legal aid, and prison reforms.

title: K.M. Abraham alleges conspiracy to denigrate him, writes to Kerala CM for police inquiry
content: K.M. Abraham, who is CM’s Chief Principal Secretary, raised the charge in a petition to Pinarayi Vijayan after High Court ordered CBI to re-investigate a disproportionate assets case against him

title: Kerala High Court orders status quo in SFIO case against CMRL, others in pay-off case
content: Court issues order on criminal revision petition filed by CMRL, which pointed out that the company was not heard before Special Court took cognisance of the complaint and decided to issue notice

title: Violence in Murshidabad ‘pre-planned’, says West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
content: CM Mamata Banerjee during a meeting with Imams and Muezzins urged Muslims not to fall into the trap of the Bharatiya Janata Party and indulge in violence on the streets; announces ₹10 lakh as compensation to victims of the violence

title: Karnataka CM accuses Modi government of ‘vindictive politics’ against Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi in National Herald case
content: Siddaramaiah accuses Narendra Modi-led government of misusing the ED, a supposedly autonomous investigative agency, as a political weapon to target opposition leaders

title: 21 cops injured in violence during demolition drive at Nashik dargah; 15 persons held
content: The injured police personnel were on security duty during the anti-encroachment drive at the spot when the incident occurred

title: Days of Mamata Banerjee-led government numbered: BJP
content: BJP leader Ravi Shankara Prasad assailed Mamata Banerjee, asking if her government has become completely insensitive to basic human values

title: Kancha Gachibowli row: Can’t have high-rises in the company of deer, Supreme Court says; directs Telangana Wildlife Warden to protect ‘forest’ immediately
content: Justice Gavai said the State would be inviting an order from the apex court to send its officials responsible for the deforestation to a temporary jail in the ‘very same spot’ destroyed by bulldozers if it dared to justify the destruction

title: Drone startup Garuda Aerospace secures ₹100-crore funding
content: Agnishwar Jayaprakash, Founder and CEO of Garuda Aerospace, told The Hindu that the funds will also be allocated in scaling up its current production facility

title: Watch: Railways tests India's first ATM-on-wheels
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: US slaps 245% retaliatory tariffs on Chinese goods as trade war intensifies
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world . read more Zodiac sign couples built for forever 10 delicious mango dishes to savour this summer Zaheer Khan and Sagarika Ghatge's candid photos that spell love!

title: Condon to enter NBA draft, keep NCAA eligibility
content: condon says he will enter the 2025 draft while maintaining his NCAA eligibility . the no. 29 prospect was named third-team All-SEC after averaging 10.6 points, 7.5 rebounds, 2.2 assists and 1.3 blocks in 24.9 minutes per game . he helped Florida to a 36-4 record, including 12 straight wins to end the season to both secure the title and cut down the nets in San Antonio .

title: Ian Darke's Premier League stars of the season: Salah, Isak, more
content: Mohamed Salah is currently top of the premier league with 27 goals and 18 assists through 32 games . but are there other serious contenders? you can expect Salah to collect the PFA Player of the Year award and the historic Football Writers' Association footballer of the year trophy .

title: Stanley Cup playoff watch: The stakes in play for Wednesday's games
content: the Minnesota Wild and St. Louis Blues clinched the two wild-card spots in the Western Conference, eliminating the Calgary Flames from postseason contention . the Columbus Blue Jackets won in regulation against the Philadelphia Flyers, keeping their slim chances intact .

title: Top moments, highlights from Warriors' play-in game win over Grizzlies
content: the Golden State Warriors beat the Memphis Grizzlies 121-116 in the play-in tournament game . the Warriors will face the no. 2 seed Houston Rockets in the first round . it's Butler's most points in a game over the last two seasons, according to ESPN Research .

title: NBA playoffs bracket
content: Content extraction failed.

title: Bubba Chandler and other prospects on the rise
content: the most-rostered pitching prospect in ESPN standard fantasy baseball leagues is RHP Bubba Chandler . he hits out 148 hitters over 119 2/3 innings at two minor league stops last season . after three starts, he boasts a 1.69 ERA and a 46% strikeout rate .

title: 'It's the best day of my golfing life': Rory McIlroy finally gets his green jacket
content: Rory McIlroy ends his long wait for a fifth major title and completes a career grand slam with a dramatic playoff victory over Justin Rose . he had walked up the final fairway not once but twice and fending off multiple players and overcoming his mistakes during an emotional 19 holes of golf . on Sunday, with the pressure of an 11-year major drought on his shoulders, Augusta's roars were prepared to serenade him during his breakthrough .

title: From A-plus Wings to C-minus Valkyries, grading every team's draft performance
content: andraya Carter is a big fan of the Washington Mystics' three first-round picks in the 2025 WNBA draft . a couple of teams have a solid chance to make the roster . there's always a chance for teams to prove these grades wrong, sometimes for better .

title: Four persons held in Tiruvannamalai on murder charges
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Caught on cam: UP doctor makes child smoke cigarette as treatment
content: the TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Saudi Arabian Grand Prix: Schedule predictions, stats
content: red bull have won three out of four races at the jeddah corniche Circuit . it's forecast to be hot, dry and settled in the desert this weekend . Saudi Arabia's Prince Khalid bin Sultan al-Abdullah al-Faisal is interested in owning an F1 team .

title: Justice BR Gavai to be the next CJI, will take oath on May 14
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Minority Affairs Ministry Isn't Just For Muslims, Says Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Minority Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju has defended his role as Chairman of the Central Waqf Council and stated that the Ministry of Minority Affairs is not exclusive to Muslims but represents all six officially recognised minority communities

title: Pak, Bangladesh Foreign Secretaries Meet After 15 Years Amid Tension With India
content: After a gap of 15 years, a Pakistani foreign secretary landed in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka to hold bilateral meetings. Amid strained India-Bangladesh ties, Pakistan has been accused of pushing its agenda of encouraging anti-India extremists.

title: "They Love Me A Lot": Robert Vadra After Probe Agency Questioning On Day 2
content: Businessman Robert Vadra -- husband of Congress's Priyanka Gandhi Vadra -- questioned for the second day in the Gurugram land case and called again for a third session, could not resist a quip today.

title: Cancer-Stricken Property Dealer Shoots Wife, Self In Ghaziabad: Police
content: A 61-year-old cancer-stricken property dealer allegedly shot dead his wife with his licensed pistol and then killed himself at his house in Radha Kunj society of Raj Nagar Extension on Wednesday, police said.

title: Woman, Son Charged For Beating 3 Puppies To Death In Madhya Pradesh: Cops
content: Police have registered a case against a woman and her son for allegedly beating three puppies to death with sticks in Morena district of Madhya Pradesh, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Desperate For Child After 7 Years Of Marriage, Delhi Woman Steals Newborn
content: Unable to conceive despite being married for seven years, a woman from south Delhi lied to her husband that she was pregnant, went to the Safdarjung Hospital, kidnapped a one-day-old girl and took her home.

title: "Can't Be Tolerated For Long": BJP MP After Meiteis Blocked From Annual Hilltop Pilgrimage
content: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Leishemba Sanajaoba on Wednesday said restrictions imposed by some groups on visiting Thangjing, a sacred site for Meiteis, is a violation of freedom of religion guaranteed by the Constitution.

title: Youth Flashes Woman, Assaults Seven People During Confrontation: Police
content: In a shocking incident, a youth flashed his private parts at a homemaker, and when confronted, he assaulted seven people, including her husband, police said on Wednesday.

title: Man Tears Passport Pages To Hide Bangkok Trips From Family, Arrested: Cops
content: A 51-year-old Pune resident was arrested at Mumbai International Airport for allegedly tearing pages from his passport to conceal his trips to Bangkok from his family, a police official said on Wednesday.

title: "Thank You": Pope To Doctors For Saving His Life During 5-Week Hospital Stay
content: Pope Francis on Wednesday thanked members of the medical team who saved his life during a five-week hospital stay for a serious case of double pneumonia, speaking softly but breathing without oxygen at the meeting in the Vatican.

title: Assam BJP Chief Shouts At Event, Himanta Sarma And Minister Walk Away. Video Viral
content: Amid Bihu celebrations in Assam, a viral video has been in the spotlight in which Assam BJP chief Dilip Saikia was seen criticising Jayanta Malla Baruah, a minister from the BJP and an aide of Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma at a party event.

title: "Cheap Stunts": Farooq Abdullah On Ex-RAW Chief's Article 370 Claim
content: The explosive claims of former chief of Research And Analysis Wing, AS Dulat, has sparked a huge political row in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: "Sister Killed In Front Of Me": Survivor On Back-To-Back Nigeria Massacres
content: People were hacked to death with machetes. Gunfire erupted everywhere, seemingly at random. No one was spared, including a nine-month-old baby.

title: "Why Christian Michel Kept With Desperate Accused In Jail?" Court Asks Tihar
content: A Delhi court on Wednesday sought an explanation from Tihar Jail authorities on why Christian Michel James, an alleged middleman in the Agustawestland case, was kept with a "desperate accused" inside the prison.

title: Man Arrested For Spraying Herbicide On Midday Meal Utensils At School: Cops
content: A tragedy was averted at a government school in Telangana's Adilabad district after alert staff discovered herbicide sprayed on utensils used for the midday meal and in the drinking water, police said on Wednesday.

title: Divorce Case: Top Court Directs Omar Abdullah, Wife To Resolve Marital Issues
content: The Supreme Court has directed Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah and his estranged wife Payal Abdullah to sit together and make an effort to resolve their matrimonial disputes.

title: How Netflix Changed Formula 1
content: It is often debated that Formula 1 should not be considered a "sport". In India, the Formula 1 Grand Prix couldn't flourish beyond 2013 due to being considered entertainment, and not sport.

title: Hyderabad's Kancha Gachibowli Row: Why Students, Environmentalists Are Protesting
content: The dispute over Kancha Gachibowli in Hyderabad has sparked a legal and environmental battle involving students, activists and the Telangana government over alleged forest land and redevelopment plans.

title: Missing Noida Teen Found, Says Ran Away As Parents Opposed Wish To Join Army
content: A class tenth student, who was missing since April 14 after he left for his coaching classes, was found at the New Delhi Railway Station on Wednesday and told police that he ran away from home as he was upset with his parents for opposing decision.

title: NDTV Exclusive: EU Special Envoy Pushes For A Rules-Based Order For Space
content: Space is for everyone to explore and technology for everyone's benefit, emphasized European Union's special envoy for Space Marjolijn van Deelen, who is in New Delhi to enhance cooperation in space between India and Europe.
